revised_title: Evolution and Classification of Ficus sect. Adenosperma
tldr: The author reviews the structure, distribution, and classification of the twenty species of Ficus sect. Adenosperma, focusing on New Guinea. The section relates to other Ficus sections through species connections and shows a neotenic trend in evolution. The author describes the various species' habits, leaves, and syconia, emphasizing the parallelism in Ficus groups and the importance of thorough study for understanding their evolution.
